results.title: Your health: your food
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Shows what happens to food when it enters the digestive system and relates this system to other body systems. Presents examples of a balanced diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Your hair and scalp
results.creator_credit: Ken Woodward, Hindle Marriott Edgar and World Wide
results.brief_description: Animated diagrams showing the structure of hair, the process of growth and how to care for one’s hair. Natural variations of hair are shown and artificial treatments. The importance of cleanliness and good grooming in maintaining both health and appearance is emphasised.

results.title: Your Guide to Antique Shopping in Britain
results.brief_description: Your Guide to Antique Shopping in Britain is a fact-filled hour of useful and discerning information for people interested in all forms of antique collecting. Where better to go than one of the great cultural, antique and fine-arts centres of the world? Rated: G

results.title: Your full attention please (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines research in the field of human attention with the focus on the apparent ability of some people to share their attention between two or more tasks at the same time.

results.title: Your friends and neighbors
results.creator_credit: Neil LaBute, Jason Patric, Steve Golin and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Neil Labute’s (“In the company of men”, “Nurse Betty”) second feature is a caustic, bleak study of sexual dysfunction and alienation amongst six casually connected friends and lovers. Labute’s brittle screenplay wanders between one relationship horror show to another as these hapless ‘friends and neighbours’ try to connect with each other through a series of empty sexual encounters and misguided affairs. Terri (Catherine Keener) can’t stand the fact that her husband Jerri (Ben Stiller) makes a lot of noise when they make love. Terri starts an affair with Cheri (Nastassja Kinski), a sensitive art gallery curator who’s neediness and insecurity requires constant validation. Jerri on the other hand finds himself infatuated with Mary (Amy Brenneman), his best friends wife. Mary’s husband Barry (Aaron Eckhart) claims the best sex he has ever had is with himself and is frustrated by his wife’s lack of sex drive. All the while Barry and Jerri’s predatory and narcissistic single friend Cary (Jason Patric) dishes out his own brand of misogynous rough justice with the countless women he sleeps with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil LaBute, Jason Patric, Steve Golin and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment

results.title: Your friend the soil: keep it - or lose it
results.brief_description: Partly animated and partly live action, this film shows how the nation’s food production depends on good farming practices such as contour ploughing and strip cropping, resulting in abundant crops, healthy farm animals and therefore, well-stocked shops. Discusses soil erosion and bad farming techniques. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Your credit is good
results.brief_description: The film opens with a sequence of artwork describing how instalment buying works. Then the message is driven home that no matter what you think, you’ve been promised verbally, no matter how good or easy it sounds - you pay what it says on the paper.
